intro: Beaufortia micrantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved beaufortia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers that bloom in winter. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests. It is well adapted to arid conditions and can survive in poor soils. Beaufortia micrantha is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
